basic.description: Mechanisms of brittle and ductile deformation, strain, rheology, and deformation mechanisms applied to geological structures and rock fabrics, with an emphasis on microstructural development of fabrics, flow paths and vorticity analysis.  Applications to problems in continental tectonics studies.  (1.5 credit units).  PREREQUISITE: Permission of the instructor EXCLUSION: GEOL 481,  GEOL-816
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Microtectonics and orogenic systems
